intro: Mapouria calothyris, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers emit a sweet fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
